com.darylteo.nio

Class DirectoryWatcherFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.darylteo.nio.DirectoryWatcherFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class DirectoryWatcherFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable

    The DirectoryWatcherFactory is responsible for creating instances of DirectoryWatcher for you. By default, each factory is configured with an ExecutorService with a single execution thread. You may increase the number of threads with the appropriate contructor.

    Every DirectoryWatcher that is created by this Factory will use the same WatchService to receive file system events. If this is not desirable, instantiate a separate DirectoryWatcherFactory.

    All created DirectoryWatcher instances can be easily cleaned up by calling close() on this Factory as it implements the AutoCloseable interface. You should do this in any cleanup process done by your application.

    See Also:
    DirectoryWatcher
